definition: board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: I can rebound and I can score occasionally.
sentences.chinese: 我偶爾能夠搶到籃板球或投籃得分。

sentences.english: I think Josh is probably a better perimeter shooter and rebounder than Ronny.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲約什在投籃和搶籃板球能力上比羅尼更好些。

sentences.english: And why is Juwon always trying to snatch the rebound away from his teammates?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼霍華德總是從他得隊友那裏掙籃板球呢？

sentences.english: Pau and Andrew, their work on the boards tonight was sensational.
sentences.chinese: 加索爾和拜納姆在保護籃板球上是很出色的。

sentences.english: He was elbowed in the face, trying to get the rebound.
sentences.chinese: 在搶籃板球時，他被胳膊肘撞到了臉。

sentences.english: I caught a rebound and made a basket.
sentences.chinese: 我搶到一個籃板球，投進了一個球。

sentences.english: He set up teammates, grabbed rebounds and made the game his.
sentences.chinese: 他助攻隊友，抓籃板球而且使整個比賽成爲他的。

sentences.english: He rebounded the ball in backcourt.
The crowd watched intently as the ball player score rebound.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆們聚精會神地看着這個球員搶下籃板球。

sentences.english: And my rebounds are also not bad.
Gasol led the Lakers with 21 points and 11 rebounds.
sentences.chinese: 加索爾帶領湖人比賽，拿下21分11個籃板球。

definition: to compete/to take part (in a sports event)
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
to serve the ball/to tee off
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
